albums.title: Sticky Fingers
albums.description: Sticky Fingers is often regarded as one of the Rolling Stones' best albums, featuring hits like 'Brown Sugar' and 'Wild Horses'.

albums.title: Exile on Main St.
albums.description: A double album that captures the essence of the Rolling Stones' sound, blending rock, blues, and gospel.

albums.title: Beggars Banquet
albums.description: Marking a return to their blues roots, this album includes classics like 'Sympathy for the Devil' and 'Street Fighting Man'.

albums.title: Let It Bleed
albums.description: This album features iconic tracks such as 'Gimme Shelter' and 'You Can't Always Get What You Want'.

albums.title: Aftermath
albums.description: Aftermath is notable for being one of the first rock albums to feature all original compositions by the band.

albums.title: Between the Buttons
albums.description: This album showcases the band's versatility with a mix of rock, pop, and psychedelic influences.

albums.title: Out of Our Heads
albums.description: Featuring the hit single '(I Can't Get No) Satisfaction', this album is a cornerstone of the Rolling Stones' early success.

albums.title: The Rolling Stones, Now!
albums.description: This album includes a mix of original songs and covers, highlighting the band's blues and R&B influences.

albums.title: Tattoo You
albums.description: A compilation of outtakes and new recordings, Tattoo You features hits like 'Start Me Up' and 'Waiting on a Friend'.

albums.title: Some Girls
albums.description: This album is known for its diverse musical styles, including disco, punk, and country influences, with hits like 'Miss You' and 'Beast of Burden'.
